name: You Shall Not Pass 1.0
description:
Sorry, the remote server you're trying to reach is Off The Grid!

Very simple idea: exploit the new Weyland Consortium Upgrade. With it active, you basically need to protect your HQ only, which can be daunting, but also has a few advantages.

Defending HQ means big ICE and loads. It also means placing layer after layer, to make it extremely expensive to run on.

Why having to protect heavily HQ is also an advantage?
Well if it costs tons of credits to go for it, every Agenda you hold in your hands will be safer. Plus many nasty cards require them to run on HQ (Emergency Shutdown for example). Finally, Escher isn't much of a weapon when you basically just have a huge vertical server, a remote that might not even have any ICE on it, and possibly few on R&D / Archives.

Sunset, then, is clearly here to pu Cell Portal, at the bottom of HQ. It is an hardly expected ICE, and when it's behind, say, an Hadrian's Wall, a Tollbooth and a Swarm with some advancements, it might be troublesome (also kinda wrecks Yogasaurus decks). You should obviously put the most dangerous ICE up front, so it'll hurt even more to start from scratch again.

You need money to do all this, so the Agenda selection works towards that, and there's all the Transactions you can get without influence. Plus Oversight AI, which can add the extra ICE that your HQ needs.

Finally, unless I'm missing something, you could always install two copies of Off the Grid on the Agenda-scoring remote: one rezzed immediately to block the Runner, the other just in case they reach HQ and trash the first. If they do, promptly rez the other one.

The server they're trying to reach will once again be Off the Grid.

name: Continuous Construction v1.0
description: Advancing your ICE to be a bad-ass Corp, or kill the Runner with your awesome Scorched Earth.

name: Ice Declined
description: Trying to build a deck around this ID. Could use some ideas...

name: Supermodernism v2.L
description:
My take on the Supermodernism v2 deck.

I've swapped out the 2x Anonymous Tip for 2x Jackson Howard. I feel being able to recall the 3x Snare (or any operation), as well as being able to mess with Indexing / R&D lock is too good of a tool to pass up in favour of increasing the draw speed.

I've swapped out the 1x Government Contracts for 1x The Cleaners, but I don't think this change is anything new. I assume Supermodernism v2.1 will do this change as well. If scored, The Cleaners allows you to 2x Scorched Earth a runner through 1x Plascrete Carapace.

I am debating dropping down to SEA Source to 1x. With Atlas, I have never found myself needing a second SEA Source to secure a flatline win. This would open up 2 influence points for many interesting cards, such as:

Neural Katana - I really like this as a facecheck punisher. Place in front of R&D and the runner dies to this and Snare.

Ichi 1.0 - Another form of program trashing to punish low program redundancy runners (mostly criminals). The trace is acceptable since we should be able to afford to make it land with Weyland's economy, and the Tag + Brain Damage really fit in to our second win condition.

Aggressive Secretary - Another form of program trashing to punish low program redundancy runners (mostly criminals). Even if this gets trashed from R&D, the runner may now believe that you are running traps and be wary of any advanced card.

Red Herrings, Ash, and Bernice Mai - Standard agenda protection upgrades and another bluff tool to make the runner run through your server to get a SEA Source off. The low trash cost and general strategy of this deck (hard ETR ice) make this less appealing.

Neural EMP - Probably not worth it as a 1x.

I will playtest both Neural Katana and Aggressive Secretary.

name: Haas-Bioroid - Version 1.1
description: Limited to 1 core set only. New to the game. 2nd Attempt at deck building. Thank you in advance to any tips or advance you can give me!

name: This Just In!
description:
Cascade one Astroscript into the next or into one of the Project Beales. This is a card draw fast score deck. Not too subtle but still difficult to stop from scoring since most of the agenda's will not be there for more than one turn.

Since most of your money comes from Operations you want to play this for the short game. The Executive Retreat is there to both Shorten the number of Agenda Cards and to allow for a quick Astroscript win with three Agendas.

Use the Snares against the Criminal Decks for their constant use of Inside Job.

name: shipment from Jinteki
description: Rely on shipment cards for advancing traps to save money
